title: Quiz 2: Amenorrhoea & Dysmenorrhoea
description: Evaluate your understanding of menstrual disorders including amenorrhoea and dysmenorrhoea management.

questions.question: The term 'Amenorrhoea' is derived from the Greek 'amenrein', which literally translates to ___BLANK___.
questions.explanation: A=without, Men=month, Rein=to flow. It interprets to 'without monthly flow'.
questions.hint: Break down the Greek roots provided in the text.

questions.question: Which of the following are considered physiological (normal) periods of amenorrhoea? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Stress causes pathological secondary amenorrhoea. Puberty, pregnancy, lactation, and menopause are physiological causes.

questions.question: Match the type of Amenorrhoea with its description/cause:

pairs.right: Menstruation occurs but blood is retained (e.g., imperforate hymen)
Menstruation has never occurred by age 17
Periods stop for more than 6 months after being established
Caused by severe postpartum haemorrhage (Sheehan's disease)

questions.explanation: Definitions of key amenorrhoea types found in the text.

questions.question: What is the drug 'Clomiphene Citrate (Clomid)' primarily used for in the management of amenorrhoea?
questions.explanation: Clomid acts on the Graafian follicle to induce ovulation in individuals desiring pregnancy.
questions.hint: It is used when the ovaries are not releasing eggs.

questions.question: Primary dysmenorrhoea (spasmodic) is usually cured by childbirth.
questions.explanation: It is said that childbirth may cure primary dysmenorrhoea because the uterus becomes more vascular and less easily ischaemic after holding a baby.
questions.hint: Consider the changes to the uterus after pregnancy.

questions.question: A 32-year-old woman complains of dull aching lower abdominal pain starting 3 days before menstruation. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation: Secondary (Congestive) Dysmenorrhoea typically affects women over 30 and pain begins days before the flow.
questions.hint: Age and timing of pain are key indicators.

questions.question: In Kenya, what is the most common cause of secondary dysmenorrhoea?

richContent.content: Context: This condition is also a major cause of infertility in women.

questions.explanation: Chronic Pelvic Inflammatory Disease (PID) is the most common cause of secondary dysmenorrhoea in this context.
questions.hint: It is an infection of the reproductive organs.

questions.question: Which drug is used to treat amenorrhoea caused by hyperprolactinaemia?
questions.explanation: Bromocriptine suppresses prolactin levels, allowing ovulation to occur.

questions.question: Arrange the management steps for primary dysmenorrhoea from conservative to invasive:
questions.explanation: Start with lifestyle, then simple drugs, then hormonal control, and finally surgery as a last resort.
questions.hint: Surgery is always the last option.

questions.question: Which of the following are symptoms of Pre-Menstrual Tension (PMT)? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: PMT involves water retention, pain, autonomic reactions, and mood changes. Fever is not a symptom.
questions.hint: Think about symptoms that occur *before* the period starts.
